{{cpp/memory/polymorphic_allocator/title|destroy}}
{{cpp/memory/polymorphic_allocator/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++17|deprecated=c++20|notes={{mark|undeprecated in C++26}}|
template&lt; class U &gt;
void destroy( U* p );
}}

Destroys the object pointed to by {{c|p}}, as if by calling {{c|p-&gt;~U()}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|p|pointer to the object being destroyed}}
{{par end}}

===Notes===
This function is deprecated via {{lwg|3036}}, because its functionality can be provided by the default implementation of {{lc|std::allocator_traits::destroy}} and hence extraneous.

This function is undeprecated via {{stddoc|P2875R4}}.
